Package test

Class Wall

Object
Wall
public class Wall extends Object
The "model" class for "Wall.Java" after refactoring it to adhere according to the MVC (Model-View-Controller) design pattern.
Author:
KhooChenNan

  • Constructor Details

    • Wall

      public Wall​(Rectangle drawArea, int brickCount, int lineCount, double brickDimensionRatio, Point ballPos)
      The constructor for the "Wall" class. It takes in 5 input parameters: drawArea, brickCount, lineCount, brickDimensionRatio, and ballPos. It sets the coordinates of the starting point to the coordinates of the ball's position. It then sets the variable "ballCount" to 3 as that is the initial life count given. A ball will then be made by passing in the starting point of coordinates. Lastly, a player and playerController for the player that was just created will be initialized too.
      Parameters:
      drawArea - The area (a coordinated space) of the game.
      brickCount - The number of bricks for the level.
      lineCount - The number of lines of bricks for the level.
      brickDimensionRatio - The brick to dimension ratio.
      ballPos - The coordinates of the ball's position.

  • Method Details

    • nextLevel

      public void nextLevel()
      A function that increases level by setting the bricks data type to the levels and the brickCount to the bricks' length.

    • hasLevel

      public boolean hasLevel()
      A boolean data type that checks the level.
      Returns:
      True if the variable "level" is smaller than "levels.length". Else, it returns false.

    • makeBall

      private void makeBall​(Point2D ballPos)
      Initializes a new ball by passing in an input parameter: The coordinates of the ball.
      Parameters:
      ballPos - The coordinates of the ball.
